page.title: 06POPULATION OF KETTLEWELL
page.content: In 1985, there are 68 men, 62 women and 35 children in Kettlewell. Eight children attend Grammar Schools in Skipton, some boarding,and five attend Upper Wharfedale Secondary School in Grassington. 26 children attend Kettlewell Primary School. 13 familes are engaged in farming. Many households are engaged in tourism, and in several families at least one member is retired. Some residents commute daily to Skipton, Grassington and Gargrave. Part-time and casual workers are employed in hotels etc. Tourism is overtaking agriculture as the prime industry. Young married couples often have to move down the Dale because of high prices of cottages. There are no council houses, or low rental houses available in the village.
